Service

Red Light Therapy (Photobiomodulation)

630–850nmCondition-specific evidence⏱ 10–20 minutes
← Back to servicesContact us

Overview

Low-level red and near-infrared light aimed at supporting cellular energy processes and local circulation.

What it is

PBM targets cellular photoacceptors (e.g., cytochrome-c oxidase) using non-ionizing light within the red/NIR optical window.

Potential benefits

  • Convenient, time-boxed sessions
  • Non-invasive and contact-free
  • Often paired with mobility or recovery work

Session flow (what to expect)

  1. Choose a target area (skin, joints, scalp).
  2. Clean skin; remove makeup/sunscreen on the target area.
  3. 10–20 minutes under the panel at a measured distance.
  4. Hydrate and resume normal activity.

Safety notes

  • Avoid shining directly into eyes; protective goggles provided.
  • Photosensitive conditions/medications, active cancer treatment, pregnancy, or recent procedures: consult your clinician.
  • Devices can be FDA-cleared for specific indications; ask about our device’s labeling.

Sources & references

  • FDA — 510(k) device database↗
  • Reviews on PBM mechanisms & optical window↗

How to book

Message us your preferred times and we’ll confirm availability.
